title: RP Record Builder

domain.label: Domain Name
domain.help: The domain name for this RP record
domain.tooltip: The domain name for which this RP record will be created

converter.title: Email to Domain Name Converter
converter.help: Enter an email to automatically convert to domain name format

mailbox.label: Mailbox Domain Name
mailbox.help: Domain name encoding the email address (use "." for no contact)
mailbox.tooltip: Domain name encoding the email address. Use '.' for no contact specified.

txt.label: TXT Domain Name
txt.help: Domain name where TXT record with contact info can be found (use "." for none)
txt.tooltip: Domain name where TXT record with additional contact information can be found. Use '.' for no additional info.

output.txtHelp: This TXT record should be created at the specified domain
output.placeholder: Fill in the required fields to generate the RP record

info.title: Information
info.noMailbox: Using "." for mailbox means no mailbox is specified
info.noTxt: Using "." for TXT means no additional text information is provided
info.txtRecord: Remember to create the TXT record at {txtDname} with contact information

warnings.title: Configuration Warnings
warnings.mailboxFqdn: Mailbox domain name should be a fully qualified domain name
warnings.txtFqdn: TXT domain name should be a fully qualified domain name or "."
warnings.mailboxDot: Domain names in RP records should end with a dot (.) for absolute names
warnings.txtDot: TXT domain name should end with a dot (.) for absolute names

about.title: About RP Records
about.description: RP (Responsible Person) records identify the responsible person for a domain or host. They specify both a mailbox (encoded as a domain name) and optionally point to a TXT record with additional contact information. This allows automated discovery of administrative contacts.

encoding.title: Email Encoding
encoding.description: Email addresses are encoded as domain names:
encoding.note: Dots in the local part are escaped with backslashes

items.fqdn: Always use fully qualified domain names ending with a dot
items.txtRecords: Create corresponding TXT records with detailed contact information
items.upToDate: Keep contact information up to date and monitored
items.rolesBased: Consider creating role-based contacts rather than personal ones
